intro: Racosperma neurophyllum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved acacia, is a shrub native to Australia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers. The plant has a woody stem with a fibrous bark, and its leaves are typically narrow and linear. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in sandy or rocky soils. Racosperma neurophyllum plays a role in stabilizing soils and providing habitat for native fauna.
